etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 海(海) (hǎi, "sea") = speech related to howling wind or loud excitement -> casual greeting
etymology.interpretation: The character 嗨 (嗨) (hāi, "hi") uses 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to suggest something related to speaking or sound, while 海(海) (hǎi, "sea") contributes the phonetic element approximating the pronunciation 'hāi.' This emphasizes a loud or enthusiastic vocal expression, fitting the use in greetings.

examples.chinese: 嗨(嗨)，我们开始吧(我們開始吧)。
他遇到老朋友时说嗨(他遇到老朋友時說嗨)。
examples.pinyin: tā yùdào lǎo péngyǒu shí shuō hāi。
examples.english: He said hi when he met his old friend.

examples.chinese: 小红看到新同学(小紅看到新同學)，便大声嗨(便大聲嗨)。
examples.pinyin: xiǎo hóng kàn dào xīn tóngxué，biàn dà shēng hāi。
examples.english: When Xiaohong saw the new classmate, she greeted loudly with a hi.
